title: College majors with the highest unemployment rates in the U.S. 2012
summary: This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. that speak English as an Additional Language ( U.S. ) at unemployed rates in Architecture as of 2012 , College .

With over half of its U.S. as non-native speakers of English , International_Business had the highest percentage of U.S. with , at the other end of the spectrum , the Political_Science_and_Government Architecture and the Fine_Arts Miscellaneous_Computer remained regions with the highest percentages of native English speaking U.S.
This also reflects the National Census data for languages .
gold: This statistic shows college majors with the highest unemployment rates in the United States between 2009 and 2012 . The rate of unemployment for students with an international business major stood at 12.3 percent in 2012 .
